Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Okay lets tackle this problem step by step First I need to understand the process flow and the rules given in Part 1 then check each case in the event log against those rules Then move on to the desiderata in Part 2 and see where those are violated Let me start by breaking down the normative constraints

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The strict sequence is Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant If Approved Finalize Documentation Close Case So each case must follow this exact order with no skipping or reversing Also specific ordering rules Credit Check before Risk Assessment Risk before Loan Decision Inform after Loan Decision For approved loans Finalize Documentation before Close Case For rejected no Finalize Documentation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now looking at the event log for each case Case 1 All steps in order Application Credit Check Risk Decision Approved Inform Finalize Close Seems compliant with all normative rules No obvious issues here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Application Received then Risk Assessment without a prior Credit Check Thats a violation of the ordering rule Credit Check must be before Risk Assessment Then Credit Check happens later Then Loan Decision Rejected followed by Finalize Documentation But since its rejected Finalize Documentation shouldnt be there So two violations order of Risk Assessment and Credit Check and Finalize after rejection

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Application Received then Credit Check happens more than 24 hours later on 114 vs 112 Thats a desideratum violation timeliness Then Risk Assessment Decision Approved Inform Applicant after 48 hours from 114 1200 to 116 1500 is 2 days 3 hours which is over 48 hours Wait 114 1200 to 116 1200 is 48 hours then 3 more hours So yes Inform Applicant is late Also no Follow up Call So these are desiderata issues but not normative violations Also Finalize Documentation and Close Case in order So Case 3 doesnt violate normative rules just the recommended timings and follow up

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: So for part 1 violations are in Case 2 For part 2 Case 3 has desiderata issues Now possible justifications For Case 2 maybe they thought Risk Assessment could be done first but the rules are strict Or maybe a system error For Case 3 delays could be due to workload or other factors but the desiderata are not strictly enforced

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait let me double check Case 3s timings Application Received on 112 0900 Credit Check on 114 1000 Thats 2 days and 1 hour later So more than 24 hours which violates the desideratum Then the Inform Applicant is on 116 1500 The Loan Decision was on 114 1200 So from Decision to Inform is 2 days 3 hours The recommendation is 48 hours 2 days so this is 3 hours over So thats another desideratum Also no Follow up Call Case 2s Risk Assessment before Credit Check is a clear normative violation Also Finalize Documentation after rejection is another So the answer should list these points Also suggest possible interpretations like maybe the team in Case 2 made a mistake or in Case 3 delays were unavoidable
